html: At the very time Jehovah brings catastrophe on those who don’t repent, he prepares a way of deliverance for those who do repent. Indeed, the destruction of the wicked is the deliverance of the righteous because when the wicked are destroyed the righteous no longer suffer oppression at their hands. As Jehovah’s Day of Judgment involves “all you who live in the world,” Jehovah gives all a chance to repent. He raises up his servant—his ensign to the nations—to rally his exiled people (Isaiah 11:10-12; 49:22; 62:10-11), warning them as a trumpet and summoning them home (Isaiah 27:13; 55:4-5; 58:1).
